caption: Table 1: Comparison with State-of-the-art Lipschitz Bandits Algorithms
description: This table compares the proposed MBAD algorithm with existing state-of-the-art algorithms for solving Lipschitz bandits.  It shows a comparison of the regret bounds (measuring algorithm performance), time complexity, and space complexity of three algorithms: Zooming, HOO, and MBAD. The table highlights that MBAD offers significant improvements in space complexity (using only constant memory) while maintaining comparable time complexity and regret bounds to existing methods.

caption: Table 1: Comparison with State-of-the-art Lipschitz Bandits Algorithms
description: This table compares the proposed MBAD algorithm with existing state-of-the-art algorithms for solving Lipschitz bandits problems.  It shows a comparison of regret bounds, time complexity, and space complexity for each algorithm.  The table highlights the superior efficiency of MBAD in terms of both time and space complexity, particularly its near-optimal regret with only a constant number of arms stored in memory.
